entry.title: Week 50, 2025: None
entry.summary: Activity report for oxcaml - Week 50, 2025

entry.title: Week 49, 2025: Core compiler advances in type systems, tooling improvements for Merlin and package management, and ongoing optimization work
entry.content:
New Features

  • Immutable arrays of unboxed products in oxcaml/oxcaml enable creation of iarrays containing unboxed product types, expanding support for layout-polymorphic immutable collections (oxcaml/oxcaml#5026)
  • Arrays of GC-ignorable values in oxcaml/oxcaml introduce Pgcignorableaddrarray kind for arrays containing pointers that do not need GC scanning, improving memory efficiency (oxcaml/oxcaml#4963)
  • AVX2 gather intrinsics in oxcaml/oxcaml add support for vectorized memory gather operations with semi-new addressing mode reg + vec[..] * scale + displ, enabling efficient scattered memory access patterns (oxcaml/oxcaml#5040)
  • Profiling output control in oxcaml/oxcaml via new -dprofile-output flag allows redirecting profiling data to specific files instead of stdout (oxcaml/oxcaml#5074)
  • Debug metrics file control in oxcaml/oxcaml through -ddwarf-metrics-output-file flag enables custom output location for DWARF debug metrics (oxcaml/oxcaml#5074)
  • No-locs compiler flag in oxcaml/oxcaml adds -no-locs option for suppressing location information in output, useful for deterministic test outputs (oxcaml/oxcaml#5072)
  • Type hovers for jkind abbreviations in oxcaml/merlin enable developers to see expanded forms when hovering over jkind annotations, including support for non-value kinds like bit32 and void, forall annotations, and type annotations (oxcaml/merlin#200)
  • Expanded compiler flag support in oxcaml/merlin adds ~30 previously unrecognized OCaml compiler flags to Merlin's ignored flags list, preventing errors when Merlin is invoked with the same flags as the compiler (oxcaml/merlin#202)
  • Domain.self_index portability in oxcaml/oxcaml annotation correctly marks Domain.self_index as portable in stdlib signature (oxcaml/oxcaml#5101)
  • Improved artifact cleanup in oxcaml/oxcaml provides finer control over compiler artifact generation and removal, fixing cases where -stop-after incorrectly deleted unrelated files (oxcaml/oxcaml#5085)
  • Quote printing fixes in oxcaml/oxcaml resolve bugs in printing character literals, string literals, quoted strings, and labelled function parameters under quotations (oxcaml/oxcaml#5079)
  • Slambda splices in Lambda in oxcaml/oxcaml add support for embedding Slambda code within Lambda expressions for metaprogramming (oxcaml/oxcaml#5023)
  • Ast_mapper quote support in oxcaml/oxcaml fixes AST mapper to correctly handle quotes and splices in parse tree transformations (oxcaml/oxcaml#5077)
  • GADT with-bounds re-enabled in oxcaml/oxcaml restores support for with-bounds constraints on GADT type parameters after previous restrictions (oxcaml/oxcaml#5046)
  • Loose staticity checking in oxcaml/oxcaml relaxes overly strict mode checks for static values in certain contexts (oxcaml/oxcaml#5075)
  • Mode error prioritization in oxcaml/oxcaml ensures application type errors are reported before mode errors for better error message clarity (oxcaml/oxcaml#5073)

    • Group Overview

  • Core compiler development in oxcaml/oxcaml dominated activity with 13 merged PRs introducing new features and 18 active contributors working on abstract kinds, unboxed arrays, flambda2 optimizations, and metaprogramming capabilities
  • Tooling improvements across oxcaml/merlin with jkind hover support (oxcaml/merlin#200) and oxcaml/opam-repository with Dune package management compatibility work (oxcaml/opam-repository#22, oxcaml/opam-repository#25)
  • Type system evolution continuing through abstract kinds foundation work in two large PRs under review (oxcaml/oxcaml#5070, oxcaml/oxcaml#5071) and jkind axis refinements (oxcaml/oxcaml#5086, oxcaml/oxcaml#5095)
  • Build and deployment infrastructure receiving attention with Dune package management build time reduced from 32 to 14 minutes (oxcaml/opam-repository#25) and name mangling redesign series launched (oxcaml/oxcaml#5097-oxcaml/oxcaml#5100)
  • No activity recorded in oxcaml/jsofocaml or janestreet/opam-repository during this period

    • Cross-Repository Work

  • Jkind system coordination between oxcaml/oxcaml and oxcaml/merlin with compiler adding jkind features (oxcaml/oxcaml#5086, oxcaml/oxcaml#5095) and Merlin adding hover support (oxcaml/merlin#200) for developer tooling integration
  • Compiler flag synchronization between oxcaml/oxcaml and oxcaml/merlin with automated testing in oxcaml/merlin#202 ensuring ~30 compiler flags are now properly handled by Merlin, including flambda-backend specific options
  • Dune package management integration connecting oxcaml/opam-repository with upstream ocaml/dune through symlink workarounds (oxcaml/opam-repository#22 addressing ocaml/dune#9873) and build concurrency fixes (oxcaml/opam-repository#25 addressing ocaml/dune#12737)
  • Documentation tooling coordination between oxcaml/opam-repository and ocaml/odoc with odoc-parser compatibility patches (oxcaml/opam-repository#22) supporting upstream work at ocaml/odoc#1392

    • Emerging Trends

  • Abstract kinds infrastructure in oxcaml/oxcaml representing fundamental type system evolution with extensive refactoring to support kind-level abstraction and eliminate circular dependencies between jkind.ml and env.ml (oxcaml/oxcaml#5070, oxcaml/oxcaml#5071)
  • Unboxed and specialized array types in oxcaml/oxcaml expanding with immutable product arrays (oxcaml/oxcaml#5026), GC-ignorable arrays (oxcaml/oxcaml#4963), and int arrays (oxcaml/oxcaml#4643) showing systematic work on layout-polymorphic data structures
  • Flambda2 optimization maturation in oxcaml/oxcaml through type rewriting (oxcaml/oxcaml#5043), improved call tracking (oxcaml/oxcaml#4809, oxcaml/oxcaml#5081), inlining heuristic refinements (oxcaml/oxcaml#5093), and comprehensive documentation (oxcaml/oxcaml#5082)
  • Metaprogramming capabilities in oxcaml/oxcaml advancing with quotation disambiguation (oxcaml/oxcaml#5094), Slambda splices (oxcaml/oxcaml#5023), improved quote printing (oxcaml/oxcaml#5079), and Ast_mapper fixes (oxcaml/oxcaml#5077)
  • Debug and tooling improvements across repositories including name mangling redesign in oxcaml/oxcaml (oxcaml/oxcaml#5097-oxcaml/oxcaml#5100), profiling output control (oxcaml/oxcaml#5074), ASAN optimization (oxcaml/oxcaml#5102), and Merlin compiler flag compatibility (oxcaml/merlin#202)
  • Jkind axis refinements in oxcaml/oxcaml with nullability becoming scannable (oxcaml/oxcaml#5086) and non_pointer64 addition to separability (oxcaml/oxcaml#5095) continuing evolution of layout representation with tooling support in oxcaml/merlin (oxcaml/merlin#200)
  • SIMD support expansion in oxcaml/oxcaml demonstrated by AVX2 gather intrinsics (oxcaml/oxcaml#5040) showing ongoing backend enhancement for vectorization
  • Dune package management integration across oxcaml/opam-repository and upstream ocaml/dune with focus on resolving compatibility issues including symlink handling (oxcaml/opam-repository#22) and build concurrency optimizations achieving over 50% build time reduction (oxcaml/opam-repository#25)
entry.summary: Core compiler advances in type systems, tooling improvements for Merlin and package management, and ongoing optimization work

entry.title: Week 48, 2025: Compiler backend surge with 10 x86 optimizations, type system improvements, Merlin sync to 5.2.0minus-24, and ecosystem compatibility work
entry.content:
New Features

  • Manifest file support in oxcaml/oxcaml via -I-manifest and -H-manifest flags allows specification of available files directly rather than entire directories (oxcaml/oxcaml#4986)
  • 128-bit integer arithmetic intrinsics in oxcaml/oxcaml including add_int128, sub_int128, mul_int64 operations compiling to efficient add/adc, sub/sbb, and imul/mul instructions (oxcaml/oxcaml#5025)
  • BMI/BMI2 intrinsics implementation in oxcaml/oxcaml with POPCNT, LZCNT support and multiple return registers in simdgen (oxcaml/oxcaml#5065)
  • Jkind hover expansion in oxcaml/merlin via Jkind.format_expanded function enables displaying full expanded forms of jkind types rather than abbreviations (oxcaml/merlin#201)
  • SIMD float16 vector types in oxcaml/merlin including float16x8, float16x16, and float16x32 variants added to Predef module (oxcaml/merlin#201)
  • Runtime_metaprogramming language extension at Alpha maturity level added to oxcaml/merlin extending experimental OCaml features (oxcaml/merlin#201)
  • Lazy type representation in oxcaml/merlin with new find_value_by_name_lazy, find_module_by_name_lazy, find_modtype_by_name_lazy functions and fold_modules_lazy/fold_modtypes_lazy for efficient traversal (oxcaml/merlin#201)
  • Unboxed elements at module top-level in oxcaml/oxcaml now allowed after fixing cross-module inlining behavior (oxcaml/oxcaml#5064)
  • Jkind normalization fuel optimization in oxcaml/oxcaml runs out of fuel only once per jkind, reusing fuel cache when normalizing with additional types (oxcaml/oxcaml#5047, oxcaml/oxcaml#5009)
  • Eio compatibility fix in oxcaml/opam-repository for eio.1.3+ox with oxcaml by explicitly currying function application in eio_mock (oxcaml/opam-repository#24)
  • New Jane Street packages in oxcaml/opam-repository including capsule, currentexe, curlasync, portablelockfreehtbl, heterogeneouslist, ppxint63literal, sexptype, unsafeclear, and bonsaiterm family (c66cb66)
  • Sedlex 3.6+ox package added to oxcaml/opam-repository providing Unicode lexer generator with ppx syntax extension support (c66cb66)
  • Skip mode hints in oxcaml/oxcaml added in several missing locations to improve mode error diagnostics (oxcaml/oxcaml#5053)
  • Chamelon minimization Ctrl-C support in oxcaml/oxcaml by replacing Sys.command with Unix module calls (oxcaml/oxcaml#5061)
  • Documentation lookup fix in oxcaml/merlin where .cms files were incorrectly prioritized over .cmti files, causing wrong documentation to be displayed for stdlib modules (55ec2f4)

    • Cross-Repository Work

  • Compiler-Merlin synchronization with oxcaml/merlin#201 merging OCaml 5.2.0minus-24 changes including manifest file parameters (oxcaml/oxcaml#4986), jkind normalization optimizations (oxcaml/oxcaml#5047, oxcaml/oxcaml#5009), and lazy environment operations (oxcaml/oxcaml#5066)
  • Jkind system evolution across oxcaml/oxcaml and oxcaml/merlin with fuel optimization in compiler (oxcaml/oxcaml#5047) coordinating with hover expansion in editor tooling (oxcaml/merlin#200)
  • Ecosystem compatibility patches in oxcaml/opam-repository supporting compiler features with eio currying fix (oxcaml/opam-repository#24), ppxlib AST updates, and jsofocaml patches (c66cb66)
  • Type system infrastructure improvements in oxcaml/oxcaml enabling lazy evaluation patterns that propagated to oxcaml/merlin with new Subst.Lazy module and lazy lookup functions (oxcaml/merlin#201)
  • Dune compatibility initiative in oxcaml/opam-repository coordinating with upstream ocaml/dune#12736 and ocaml/odoc#1392 to ensure packages build with both Dune package management and opam (oxcaml/opam-repository#21, oxcaml/opam-repository#22)
  • Unboxed module elements coordination in oxcaml/oxcaml with Chris Casinghino reverting initial implementation (oxcaml/oxcaml#5056) followed by James Rayman fixing cross-module inlining and re-enabling (oxcaml/oxcaml#5064)
  • Magic number synchronization across oxcaml/oxcaml and oxcaml/merlin with bump to 570 for 5.2.0minus-24 release (oxcaml/oxcaml#5048) matching Merlin update (00e7d73)

    • Emerging Trends

  • Backend optimization momentum in oxcaml/oxcaml with systematic x86 peephole work establishing patterns for instruction-level optimization including flag liveness analysis, pseudo-liveness tracking, and comprehensive CI testing (oxcaml/oxcaml#5028, oxcaml/oxcaml#5018, oxcaml/oxcaml#5016, oxcaml/oxcaml#4985, oxcaml/oxcaml#4977)
  • Type system maturation across oxcaml/oxcaml and oxcaml/merlin through jkind normalization improvements (oxcaml/oxcaml#5047), mode system refinements (oxcaml/oxcaml#5053, oxcaml/oxcaml#5058), preparation for abstract kinds (oxcaml/oxcaml#5070), and tooling enhancements (oxcaml/merlin#200)
  • Lazy evaluation paradigm spreading throughout codebase with lazy type representation in oxcaml/merlin via Subst.Lazy module (oxcaml/merlin#201), lazy environment lookups, and deferred substitution operations to improve performance with complex type signatures
  • Intrinsics library expansion in oxcaml/oxcaml targeting both x86 (BMI/BMI2) and ARM64 platforms with focus on efficient compilation of low-level operations (oxcaml/oxcaml#5025, oxcaml/oxcaml#5065), and ongoing ARM64 intrinsics work (oxcaml/oxcaml#5024)
  • Flambda2 consolidation in oxcaml/oxcaml removing long-disabled features (oxcaml/oxcaml#5051), refactoring for clarity (oxcaml/oxcaml#5049, oxcaml/oxcaml#5038), while preparing for type rewriting capabilities (oxcaml/oxcaml#5043, oxcaml/oxcaml#5050)
  • Dune package management compatibility emerging as priority in oxcaml/opam-repository with patches addressing symlink limitations and ensuring packages build with both systems (oxcaml/opam-repository#21, oxcaml/opam-repository#22), coordinating with upstream ocaml/dune#12736 and ocaml/odoc#1392
  • Cross-module optimization work in oxcaml/oxcaml addressing mixed module blocks and classic mode approximation issues to improve inlining behavior (oxcaml/oxcaml#5058, oxcaml/oxcaml#5064)
  • Developer experience focus with repository cleanup (oxcaml/oxcaml#5067), tooling improvements (oxcaml/oxcaml#4986), build system fixes (oxcaml/oxcaml#5010), and debugging enhancements (oxcaml/oxcaml#5062, oxcaml/oxcaml#4916)
  • Regular preview releases in oxcaml/opam-repository with version bump pattern v0.18~preview.130.76+222 indicating active development and testing cycle for Jane Street packages (c66cb66)
entry.summary: Compiler backend surge with 10 x86 optimizations, type system improvements, Merlin sync to 5.2.0minus-24, and ecosystem compatibility work

entry.title: Week 47, 2025: Compiler advances in mixed modules, type system, backend CFG optimizations, runtime GC improvements, and editor tooling
entry.content:
New Features

  • Mixed module support enables unboxed elements at top-level of modules through Module_mixed representation with mixed block shapes, allowing modules to contain both values and unboxed primitives in oxcaml/oxcaml#4020
  • Jkind expansion API adds format_expanded function for Merlin to display fully-expanded jkinds on hover in oxcaml/oxcaml#5041
  • Architecture compile-time constants via %arch_amd64 and %arch_arm64 builtins plus Sys.architecture for runtime detection in oxcaml/oxcaml#4972
  • Unoptimized probes implementation for arm64 with enabled_at_init field on Probe_is_enabled primitive and -probes-optimized/-no-probes-optimized flags in oxcaml/oxcaml#5007
  • CFG value propagation extended to float values (Const_float and Const_float32) with terminator simplification improvements in oxcaml/oxcaml#4879 and oxcaml/oxcaml#4807
  • CFG reducibility checking via Cfg_reducibility module to validate loop information trustworthiness in oxcaml/oxcaml#4920
  • Fiber error handling raises Effect.Out_of_fibers exception instead of Out_of_memory when mmap stack allocation fails in oxcaml/oxcaml#5021
  • Fiber cache limit via -Xcache_stacks_per_class= GC parameter to prevent unbounded memory growth in oxcaml/oxcaml#5017
  • GC stat sampling includes current minor words for more accurate Gc.quick_stat results in single-domain programs in oxcaml/oxcaml#5030
  • Makefile cleanup targets with make clean and make distclean preserving editor configs in oxcaml/oxcaml#5035
  • Runtime metaprogramming extension gates quotes, splices, and quotation evaluation in oxcaml/oxcaml#5012
  • Merlin outline functionality now includes items from include statements, enabling editor users (particularly Emacs imenu) to navigate to definitions within included modules, benefiting ppx_template users in oxcaml/merlin#199

    • Cross-Repository Work

  • Jkind type hover support in Merlin awaits upstream compiler API from oxcaml/oxcaml#5041 before Liam Stevenson can complete draft PR oxcaml/merlin#200, demonstrating coordinated development between the compiler and editor tooling
  • Compiler-editor integration enabled through jkind expansion API in oxcaml/oxcaml#5041 specifically designed to support Merlin's type information display capabilities

    • Emerging Trends

  • Unboxed types maturation shown through mixed modules at top-level in oxcaml/oxcaml#4020, immutable arrays of unboxed products in oxcaml/oxcaml#5026, and enhanced type system support for existentials in oxcaml/oxcaml#4995
  • Backend optimization focus evidenced by CFG value propagation extensions in oxcaml/oxcaml#4879 and oxcaml/oxcaml#4807, reducibility checking in oxcaml/oxcaml#4920 and oxcaml/oxcaml#4921, probes implementation in oxcaml/oxcaml#5007 and oxcaml/oxcaml#5011, and multiple WIP peephole optimizations in oxcaml/oxcaml#5018, oxcaml/oxcaml#5016, oxcaml/oxcaml#5028, oxcaml/oxcaml#5032, and oxcaml/oxcaml#5033
  • Type system precision advances through jkind inference improvements in oxcaml/oxcaml#5039 and oxcaml/oxcaml#5009, scannable axis development in oxcaml/oxcaml#5006 and oxcaml/oxcaml#5031, mode checking enhancements in oxcaml/oxcaml#5029 and oxcaml/oxcaml#5034, and upstream synchronization in oxcaml/oxcaml#5015
  • Runtime performance improvements through GC micro-optimizations reducing global access in oxcaml/oxcaml#4997 and oxcaml/oxcaml#5022, fiber cache management in oxcaml/oxcaml#5017, error handling improvements in oxcaml/oxcaml#5021, and profiling accuracy in oxcaml/oxcaml#5030
  • SIMD and intrinsics expansion with AVX2 gather instructions in oxcaml/oxcaml#5040, 128-bit arithmetic in oxcaml/oxcaml#5025, architecture detection in oxcaml/oxcaml#4972, and arm64 platform parity in oxcaml/oxcaml#5024 and oxcaml/oxcaml#5037
  • Editor integration enhancements continue with Merlin outline improvements in oxcaml/merlin#199 and preparation for advanced type information display in oxcaml/merlin#200, coordinating with compiler API development in oxcaml/oxcaml#5041
entry.summary: Compiler advances in mixed modules, type system, backend CFG optimizations, runtime GC improvements, and editor tooling

entry.title: Week 46, 2025: Compiler work on modes system, SIMD intrinsics, and slambda IR with IDE tooling improvements in Merlin
entry.content:
New Features

  • Shareable mode added to portability axis in oxcaml/oxcaml, distinguishing functions that capture shared state and can execute in parallel from portable (contended) and nonportable (uncontended) functions (oxcaml/oxcaml#4982)
  • Slambda intermediate representation introduced in oxcaml/oxcaml as new compilation phase between lambda and static evaluation, with -dslambda flag for debugging (oxcaml/oxcaml#4776)
  • SIMD load/store intrinsics for all SSE and AVX operations using memory operands in oxcaml/oxcaml, including specialized handling for maskmovdqu with implicit RDI addressing (oxcaml/oxcaml#4994, oxcaml/oxcaml#4988)
  • Global implies aliased constraint enforced syntactically in oxcaml/oxcaml, preventing unsound @@ global unique combinations for future borrowing implementation (oxcaml/oxcaml#4889)
  • Mode hints for containing relationships added between containers (tuples, records, arrays) and their elements in oxcaml/oxcaml, improving error messages (oxcaml/oxcaml#4919)
  • Share context moved to mode hints in oxcaml/oxcaml through new Is_used_in hint and Const_closure_lock, replacing previous share_context mechanism (oxcaml/oxcaml#4983)
  • Camlinternaleval shared JIT in oxcaml/oxcaml allowing mdx to reuse bindings across fragments without bundle mechanism (oxcaml/oxcaml#4900, oxcaml/oxcaml#4909, oxcaml/oxcaml#4899)
  • Installation of .cms files alongside .cmt files in oxcaml/oxcaml for debug information and Merlin integration, adding 352 files (~4 MB) (oxcaml/oxcaml#5005)
  • AFL instrumentation flags support (-afl-instrument and -afl-inst-ratio) added to oxcaml/merlin to enable fuzzing workflows without Merlin interference (oxcaml/merlin#198)
  • Ghost location filtering in syntax documentation for oxcaml/merlin to fix spurious [@nontail] attribute hints from PPX-generated ghost nodes (oxcaml/merlin#197)
  • Parameterized library crash prevention in oxcaml/merlin through proper handling of module name types and dependency tracking in short path analysis (oxcaml/merlin#196)

    • Group Overview

  • Primary activity concentrated in oxcaml/oxcaml with 27 new PRs and substantial compiler infrastructure work spanning modes system, SIMD intrinsics, metaprogramming, and type system development
  • oxcaml/merlin delivered 3 bug fixes addressing parameterized libraries, syntax documentation accuracy, and fuzzing infrastructure compatibility
  • oxcaml/opam-repository, oxcaml/jsofocaml, and janestreet/opam-repository showed no activity this week
  • Cross-repository coordination evident through .cms file installation in oxcaml/oxcaml for Merlin integration and upstream OCaml collaboration on ocaml/ocaml#13866

    • Cross-Repository Work

  • Merlin integration coordinated between oxcaml/oxcaml and oxcaml/merlin through .cms file installation alongside .cmt files for debug information (oxcaml/oxcaml#5005), enabling better IDE tooling support
  • Parameterized libraries support improved in both oxcaml/oxcaml with unboxed module elements (oxcaml/oxcaml#4020) and oxcaml/merlin with crash prevention fixes (oxcaml/merlin#196)
  • Upstream OCaml collaboration on ocaml/ocaml#13866 with Florian Angeletti providing the upstream occur_rec optimization that Liam Stevenson is downstreaming to oxcaml/oxcaml (oxcaml/oxcaml#5015)

    • Notable Discussions

  • Upstream downstreaming coordination on oxcaml/oxcaml#5015 for ocaml/ocaml#13866 involving Florian Angeletti who provided the upstream fix that Liam Stevenson is downstreaming, with Richard Eisenberg planning performance benchmarks
  • Mixed module implementation review on oxcaml/oxcaml#4020 for top-level unboxed elements with detailed discussions on module representations, coercions, parameterized libraries, and toplevel limitations between James Rayman, Vincent Laviron, Chris Casinghino, and Mark Shinwell
  • Jkind normalization approach discussion on oxcaml/oxcaml#4995 between Liam Stevenson and Richard Eisenberg on using Tof_jkind versus tracking existentials, with questions about fixed parameter usage and type levels
  • GC-ignorable arrays semantics clarification on oxcaml/oxcaml#4963 between @dkalinichenko-js and Vincent Laviron regarding caml_modify skipping and scanner behavior for external values
  • Scannable axes design decisions on oxcaml/oxcaml#4992 between Zack Eisbach and Ryan Tjoa covering warning messages, parsetree structure, CR conventions, and terminology choices for kind modifiers

    • Emerging Trends

  • Modes system maturation evident through shareable mode addition (oxcaml/oxcaml#4982), mode hints refactoring (oxcaml/oxcaml#4983), crossing infrastructure (oxcaml/oxcaml#4781), and global-aliased constraints (oxcaml/oxcaml#4889) representing systematic expansion of the modes type system in oxcaml/oxcaml
  • SIMD intrinsics buildout continuing with load/store operations (oxcaml/oxcaml#4994), memory operand generalization (oxcaml/oxcaml#4988), and addressing mode support showing commitment to complete SIMD instruction coverage in oxcaml/oxcaml
  • Metaprogramming infrastructure development through slambda IR (oxcaml/oxcaml#4776), Camlinternaleval improvements (oxcaml/oxcaml#4900), translquote review (oxcaml/oxcaml#4981), and runtime metaprogramming extension (oxcaml/oxcaml#5012) indicating preparation for staged compilation in oxcaml/oxcaml
  • Type system sophistication advancing with pointerness axes (oxcaml/oxcaml#5006), jkind normalization fuel increases (oxcaml/oxcaml#5009), unboxed module elements (oxcaml/oxcaml#4020), and GC-ignorable arrays (oxcaml/oxcaml#4963) extending layout expressiveness in oxcaml/oxcaml
  • Debugging tooling investment through .cms file installation (oxcaml/oxcaml#5005), DWARF improvements (oxcaml/oxcaml#4934), name mangling (oxcaml/oxcaml#4850), and LLDB plugin (oxcaml/oxcaml#4961) demonstrating focus on developer experience across oxcaml/oxcaml
  • Performance optimization efforts spanning GC marking loops (oxcaml/oxcaml#4997), peephole optimizations (oxcaml/oxcaml#4985), and profile collection infrastructure (oxcaml/oxcaml#5004) showing attention to runtime efficiency in oxcaml/oxcaml
  • IDE tooling stability improvements with parameterized library fixes (oxcaml/merlin#196), PPX ecosystem compatibility (oxcaml/merlin#197), and fuzzing infrastructure integration (oxcaml/merlin#198) in oxcaml/merlin
entry.summary: Compiler work on modes system, SIMD intrinsics, and slambda IR with IDE tooling improvements in Merlin

entry.title: Week 45, 2025: Mode system maturation, SIMD expansion, and performance optimizations across compiler and tooling with 37 PRs merged.
entry.content:
New Features

  • F16C and FMA SIMD intrinsics added with new Float16x8, Float16x16, and Float16x32 vector types for half-precision floating-point operations, plus fused multiply-add support in oxcaml/oxcaml#4964 by Max Slater
  • Domain index API exposed via Domain.self_index() to get a unique integer identifier for the current domain, in range [0; N-1] where N is the peak number of simultaneously running domains in oxcaml/oxcaml#4950 by Vesa Karvonen
  • Thread-local storage primitive %tls_get added for accessing thread-local state blocks, complementing the existing domain-local state in oxcaml/oxcaml#4959 by Max Slater
  • Untagged char range patterns now supported (e.g., #'a'..#'z') with improved match exhaustion checking for small integers and unboxed ints in oxcaml/oxcaml#4729 by James Rayman
  • Short-paths graph construction in Merlin no longer forces expensive substitutions, addressing performance issues in large modules especially with ppx_template in oxcaml/merlin#193 by Liam Stevenson
  • Parser generation in Merlin now uses --lalr flag for menhir invocations, matching the compiler's configuration for improved parser performance in oxcaml/merlin#194 by Liam Stevenson
  • Index caching in Merlin refactored to use lazy evaluation, with the index buffer only computed when queries actually need it in oxcaml/merlin#195 by Liam Stevenson
  • Unix module local annotations added to parameters in functions like execv, execve, openfile, read, write, stat, lstat, and many file operations to support locality modes in oxcaml/oxcaml#4830 by Vesa Karvonen
  • Quiet flag for ocamldebug (-quiet) suppresses printing while executing initialization files, useful for cleaner startup in scripts in oxcaml/oxcaml#4869 by Jakub Bachurski
  • Locking scheme version added to track runtime locking protocol changes in oxcaml/oxcaml#4958
  • Stdlib local annotations now printed for standard library functions to improve visibility of locality mode constraints in oxcaml/oxcaml#4943
  • Skiplist for natdynlink roots in the runtime improves performance of dynamic linking in oxcaml/oxcaml#4949

    • Group Overview

  • 37 PRs merged across oxcaml/oxcaml (34 PRs) and oxcaml/merlin (3 PRs) with 17 new PRs opened in oxcaml/oxcaml
  • Mode system maturation was the primary focus with Zesen Qian leading 11 merged PRs covering legacy syntax removal (oxcaml/oxcaml#4984, oxcaml/oxcaml#4968), improved error messages (oxcaml/oxcaml#4979), and mode compilation (oxcaml/oxcaml#4792)
  • SIMD capabilities expanded with F16C/FMA support (oxcaml/oxcaml#4964) and new WIP PRs for generalized memory operands (oxcaml/oxcaml#4988) and cast improvements (oxcaml/oxcaml#4987)
  • Performance optimization was a cross-repository theme with Xavier Clerc opening 5 WIP PRs on x86 peephole optimizations (oxcaml/oxcaml#4973, oxcaml/oxcaml#4975, oxcaml/oxcaml#4977, oxcaml/oxcaml#4985) and Liam Stevenson improving Merlin's type-checking performance (oxcaml/merlin#193) and making module finding lazy (oxcaml/oxcaml#4970)
  • Type system and jkinds work included adding levels to sort variables (oxcaml/oxcaml#4785), fixing or_null with default optional arguments (oxcaml/oxcaml#4953), and exceptions crossing statefulness (oxcaml/oxcaml#4891)
  • Locality mode annotations continued spreading through the standard library with Unix module coverage (oxcaml/oxcaml#4830) and improved printing support (oxcaml/oxcaml#4943)

    • Cross-Repository Work

  • Performance optimization collaboration with Liam Stevenson contributing lazy evaluation improvements to both oxcaml/oxcaml (oxcaml/oxcaml#4970 for lazy module finding) and oxcaml/merlin (oxcaml/merlin#193 for lazy short-paths, oxcaml/merlin#195 for lazy indexing)
  • Merlin alignment with compiler through parser generation flag matching in oxcaml/merlin#194, bringing Merlin's menhir configuration in line with the oxcaml compiler
  • Upstream backporting from ocaml/merlin continuing with ocaml/merlin#1990 and ocaml/merlin#1991 being backported to oxcaml/merlin in oxcaml/merlin#195
  • Mode system improvements in the compiler (oxcaml/oxcaml#4792, oxcaml/oxcaml#4984, oxcaml/oxcaml#4968) will require corresponding updates in Merlin for proper IDE support

    • Emerging Trends

  • Mode system stabilization with migration away from legacy syntax (oxcaml/oxcaml#4984, oxcaml/oxcaml#4968), improved error messages (oxcaml/oxcaml#4979), and better tooling integration (oxcaml/oxcaml#4943)
  • Lazy evaluation patterns being applied systematically across the codebase for performance gains in short-paths (oxcaml/merlin#193), module finding (oxcaml/oxcaml#4970), and indexing (oxcaml/merlin#195)
  • SIMD instruction set expansion continuing with F16C/FMA support (oxcaml/oxcaml#4964) and ongoing work on memory operands (oxcaml/oxcaml#4988) and type conversions (oxcaml/oxcaml#4987)
  • Compiler optimization infrastructure being built out with peephole optimization framework (oxcaml/oxcaml#4973, oxcaml/oxcaml#4975, oxcaml/oxcaml#4977, oxcaml/oxcaml#4985) and runtime improvements (oxcaml/oxcaml#4949)
  • Locality mode adoption spreading through standard library APIs with Unix module coverage (oxcaml/oxcaml#4830) and enhanced visibility through annotation printing (oxcaml/oxcaml#4943)
entry.summary: Mode system maturation, SIMD expansion, and performance optimizations across compiler and tooling with 37 PRs merged.

entry.title: Week 44, 2025: Compiler improvements with thread naming, Flambda2 type system advances, debugging infrastructure, and package maintenance
entry.content:
New Features

  • Thread naming support added via Thread.set_current_thread_name function backported from upstream OCaml by Aspen Smith, enabling developers to set thread names for improved debugging in GDB and stacktraces (oxcaml/oxcaml#4946)
  • Extended locking scheme interface with caml_domain_send_interrupt_hook callback by Stephen Dolan for better backup thread interactions in multi-domain programs using non-default locking schemes, improving Python integration support (oxcaml/oxcaml#4914)
  • Native Dynlink fix for parameterized modules by Luke Maurer, now correctly using Compilation_unit.full_path_as_string instead of name_as_string to distinguish compilation units differing only by arguments (oxcaml/oxcaml#4935)
  • DWARF test improvements by Simon Spies with pedantic mode enabled by default and new test coverage for closures, larger data structures, tuples, and bigarrays to prevent regressions (oxcaml/oxcaml#4626)
  • CI infrastructure upgrades by Jacob Van Buren deploying larger GitHub Actions runners across all CI jobs for improved build performance (oxcaml/oxcaml#4908)
  • Metrics collection modernization by Xavier Clerc translating bash scripts to Python with type annotations and extensible CSV format supporting different metric types beyond artifact sizes (oxcaml/oxcaml#4926, oxcaml/oxcaml#4927)
  • Dune version constraint relaxation in ocaml-variants.5.2.0+ox from exact version 3.20.2+ox to allow versions greater than 3.20.2 by Patrick Ferris (oxcaml/opam-repository@159337c)

    • Group Overview

  • Week 44 saw concentrated activity in the oxcaml/oxcaml compiler repository with 15 contributors advancing runtime features, type system improvements, debugging infrastructure, and CI modernization
  • Package maintenance work in oxcaml/opam-repository focused on jsofocaml patch compatibility with stricter opam validation logic (oxcaml/opam-repository#19, oxcaml/opam-repository#20)
  • Flambda2 type system received significant enhancements with relations stored as projections enabling precise optimization analysis (oxcaml/oxcaml#4390)
  • Modality system maturation continued with multiple PRs addressing stateless, contended, aliased, and portable annotations across the type system and stdlib (oxcaml/oxcaml#4889, oxcaml/oxcaml#4891, oxcaml/oxcaml#4929)
  • DWARF debugging infrastructure saw substantial progress with runtime type information layout improvements, shape constructors, function sections support, and phantom variable handling (oxcaml/oxcaml#4916, oxcaml/oxcaml#4928, oxcaml/oxcaml#4934, oxcaml/oxcaml#4595)

    • Cross-Repository Work

  • Package patches aligned with compiler changes as oxcaml/opam-repository jsofocaml iarray primitives patch was updated to match runtime code structure changes in oxcaml/oxcaml, with Patrick Ferris coordinating both repositories (oxcaml/opam-repository#19)
  • CI infrastructure modernization with Python metrics collection in oxcaml/oxcaml potentially benefiting package building workflows in oxcaml/opam-repository (oxcaml/oxcaml#4926, oxcaml/oxcaml#4927)
  • Upstream OCaml synchronization with thread naming feature backported from upstream ocaml/ocaml to oxcaml/oxcaml (oxcaml/oxcaml#4946) and domain index proposal referencing ocaml/ocaml#13171 (oxcaml/oxcaml#4950)

    • Notable Discussions

  • Patch validation compatibility discussion in oxcaml/opam-repository#19 revealed that recent opam versions switched to stricter patch validation logic than GNU patch, with resolution that publishing code now uses the same logic to prevent future errors
  • ppxoptcomp dependency investigation in oxcaml/opam-repository#20 examined how patches that had previously been removed returned, suggesting potential interactions with other patch sets that may have introduced ppxoptcomp as a dependency
  • Flambda2 type grammar review in oxcaml/oxcaml#4390 with Vincent Laviron providing extensive feedback on type variance consistency and projection handling during n-way joins
  • Linkenv API mutability analysis in oxcaml/oxcaml#4947 with Jack Rickard reviewing potential re-entry issues in global state removal

    • Emerging Trends

  • Type system sophistication continuing with Flambda2 relations stored as projections enabling more precise optimization analysis (oxcaml/oxcaml#4390) and the match-in-match heuristic requiring careful handling of type variance (oxcaml/oxcaml#4374, oxcaml/oxcaml#4394)
  • Debugging infrastructure maturation across DWARF generation (oxcaml/oxcaml#4626, oxcaml/oxcaml#4916), phantom variables (oxcaml/oxcaml#4595), name mangling (oxcaml/oxcaml#4850), and test coverage indicating production readiness priorities
  • Modality system evolution with stateless, contended, aliased, and portable annotations being refined through stdlib usage (oxcaml/oxcaml#4839, oxcaml/oxcaml#4930) and soundness fixes (oxcaml/oxcaml#4889, oxcaml/oxcaml#4891)
  • Parameterized modules refinement addressing edge cases in Dynlink (oxcaml/oxcaml#4935) and alias handling (oxcaml/oxcaml#4948) while automatic field reordering enables mixed module support (oxcaml/oxcaml#4020)
  • Infrastructure modernization with Python replacing bash scripts (oxcaml/oxcaml#4926), CI runner upgrades (oxcaml/oxcaml#4908), and extensible metrics collection (oxcaml/oxcaml#4927) supporting performance tracking
  • Backend optimization focus on CFG analysis including value propagation (oxcaml/oxcaml#4879), reducibility checking (oxcaml/oxcaml#4920), and peephole optimizations (oxcaml/oxcaml#4932) for better code generation
  • Concurrent programming support through preemption work (oxcaml/oxcaml#4881), locking scheme extensions (oxcaml/oxcaml#4914), thread naming (oxcaml/oxcaml#4946), and domain-aware primitives (oxcaml/oxcaml#4950)
  • Patch maintenance challenges as stricter opam validation requires closer alignment between patch generation and application tools (oxcaml/opam-repository#19)
entry.summary: Compiler improvements with thread naming, Flambda2 type system advances, debugging infrastructure, and package maintenance

entry.title: Week 43, 2025: Runtime threading and GC improvements, mode system refinements, and LLVM backend development across compiler and tooling
entry.content:
New Features

  • GC debugging control added via Xenable_segv_handler=0 tweak to disable SIGSEGV handler for better coredump analysis during segfaults (oxcaml/oxcaml#4913)
  • Phantom bindings support implemented in Flambda2 allowing debug information generation without keeping dead code alive, controlled via -gdwarf-may-alter-codegen-experimental flag (oxcaml/oxcaml#3937)
  • Domain locking unification merging backup thread and systhreads locks into single mechanism, enabling Python interop with multi-domain programs (oxcaml/oxcaml#4769)
  • Runtime4 TLS fix for threads created via caml_c_thread_register ensuring proper thread-local storage initialization (oxcaml/oxcaml#4915)
  • LLVM backend now implements Dls_get operation for domain-local storage access (oxcaml/oxcaml#4903)
  • Mode hint improvements providing clearer error messages for allocation and regional mode errors with full hint chains (oxcaml/oxcaml#4917)
  • Regional mode printing simplified to show "local to the parent region" consistently instead of special-cased "regional" (oxcaml/oxcaml#4918)
  • Compiler crash fix for width checking in record types with crossing annotations preventing segfaults (oxcaml/oxcaml#4902)
  • Primitive simplification fix resolving binding ordering bug when extra bindings were introduced during optimization (oxcaml/oxcaml#4923)
  • LLVM flag handling updated in Merlin to ignore -llvm-backend and -no-llvm-backend flags, with -llvm-path moved to parametrized flags (oxcaml/merlin#192)

    • Group Overview

  • Primary activity concentrated in oxcaml/oxcaml with 11 merged features and 25+ ongoing development efforts spanning runtime, type system, and backend improvements
  • Tooling coordination demonstrated through oxcaml/merlin#192 updating configuration to support new LLVM compiler flags from oxcaml/oxcaml#4903 and oxcaml/oxcaml#4904
  • Runtime focus on threading model improvements with domain lock unification (oxcaml/oxcaml#4769), backup thread locking enhancements (oxcaml/oxcaml#4914), and TLS fixes (oxcaml/oxcaml#4915)
  • Type system development advancing mode system error messages (oxcaml/oxcaml#4917), crossing syntax parsing (oxcaml/oxcaml#4781), and experimental ikind algorithms (oxcaml/oxcaml#4675)
  • Backend expansion with LLVM domain-local storage support (oxcaml/oxcaml#4903), jsofocaml test integration (oxcaml/oxcaml#4753), and CFG optimization work (oxcaml/oxcaml#4920)
  • No activity recorded in oxcaml/opam-repository, oxcaml/jsofocaml, or janestreet/opam-repository during this period

    • Cross-Repository Work

  • LLVM backend integration between oxcaml/oxcaml and oxcaml/merlin with Greta Yorsh implementing Dls_get operation (oxcaml/oxcaml#4903) and proposing -no-llvm-backend flag (oxcaml/oxcaml#4904), followed by Liam Stevenson updating Merlin configuration to handle these new compiler flags (oxcaml/merlin#192)
  • jsofocaml testing infrastructure work in oxcaml/oxcaml#4753 by Jacob Van Buren establishing test integration between the compiler and the oxcaml/jsofocaml JavaScript backend
  • Tooling synchronization pattern established where compiler flag changes in oxcaml/oxcaml trigger corresponding updates in oxcaml/merlin to maintain IDE compatibility

    • Emerging Trends

  • Runtime concurrency advancing through domain lock unification (oxcaml/oxcaml#4769), backup thread improvements (oxcaml/oxcaml#4914), TLS fixes (oxcaml/oxcaml#4915), and large-scale preemption implementation (oxcaml/oxcaml#4881)
  • Mode system maturation progressing with improved error messages (oxcaml/oxcaml#4917), crossing syntax (oxcaml/oxcaml#4781), regional printing simplification (oxcaml/oxcaml#4918), and experimental ikind algorithms (oxcaml/oxcaml#4675)
  • Debugging infrastructure expanding with phantom bindings (oxcaml/oxcaml#3937), GC handler control (oxcaml/oxcaml#4913), debug layouts (oxcaml/oxcaml#4916), and reversible name mangling (oxcaml/oxcaml#4850)
  • Backend diversification through LLVM domain-local storage (oxcaml/oxcaml#4903), jsofocaml integration (oxcaml/oxcaml#4753), and CFG optimization (oxcaml/oxcaml#4920, oxcaml/oxcaml#4921)
  • Metaprogramming support developing through quotation system fixes (oxcaml/oxcaml#4906, oxcaml/oxcaml#4911, oxcaml/oxcaml#4912, oxcaml/oxcaml#4910) and slambda IR introduction (oxcaml/oxcaml#4776)
  • Type system power growing with mixed modules (oxcaml/oxcaml#4020), untagged arrays (oxcaml/oxcaml#4643), and effect primitive refactoring (oxcaml/oxcaml#4901)
entry.summary: Runtime threading and GC improvements, mode system refinements, and LLVM backend development across compiler and tooling

entry.title: Week 42, 2025: Metaprogramming advances, Merlin integration of quotation infrastructure, and js_of_ocaml patch maintenance
entry.content:
New Features

  • New quotation API functions Code.Closed.to_exp and Code.Closed.print added to CamlinternalQuote module for converting closed code to expressions and formatted printing in oxcaml/oxcaml#4896
  • Quotation and metaprogramming support integrated into Merlin via new CamlinternalQuote module (2,805 lines) providing infrastructure for compile-time code generation with variable binding, staging, and AST manipulation facilities in oxcaml/merlin#191
  • Layout polymorphism language extension (Layout_poly) with maturity levels (alpha, beta, stable) allowing types to be polymorphic over memory representations in oxcaml/merlin#191
  • New jkind primitives including immediate64_or_null for nullable immediate64 values and kind_of_idx for block indices with mode crossing support in oxcaml/merlin#191
  • Stage tracking in environment with new stage type and operations enter_quotation, enter_splice, and check_no_open_quotations for managing multi-stage compilation contexts in oxcaml/merlin#191
  • bits8 and bits16 kinds now allowed without requiring the small_numbers extension in oxcaml/oxcaml#4898, improving library integration while maintaining upstream compatibility
  • Improved location information in pattern matching for better debugger stepping behavior and source code position reporting in oxcaml/oxcaml#4884
  • Enhanced debugger register handling in Name_for_debugger operations with proper register substitution and unknown location handling in oxcaml/oxcaml#4880
  • Shrink-wrapping testing now enabled in CI through new option to regalloc.exe tool for inserting prologues in oxcaml/oxcaml#4892
  • Fixed over-expunged toplevel by removing unboxed types (Float_u, Iarray, Int32_u, Int64_u, Nativeint_u) not in compatible Stdlib in oxcaml/oxcaml#4877
  • Fixed loading paths from paths file bug in load_path.ml where variable shadowing caused incorrect path resolution for -I-paths flag in oxcaml/oxcaml#4878
  • New compiler warning 215 (Implied_attribute) detecting when attributes are redundant because they're implied by other attributes in oxcaml/merlin#191

    • Cross-Repository Work

  • Merlin integration of OxCaml compiler features with Mark Shinwell merging OxCaml 5.2.0minus-22 in oxcaml/merlin#191, bringing quotation support and layout polymorphism from oxcaml/oxcaml into Merlin editor tooling with 168 files changed (32,413 insertions, 24,515 deletions)
  • jsofocaml patch management in oxcaml/opam-repository with Patrick Ferris addressing patch regressions in oxcaml/opam-repository#20 and iarray compatibility issues in oxcaml/opam-repository#19, investigating coordination with oxcaml/jsofocaml dependency versions
  • Repository branding transition with Merlin import script updated to target oxcaml/oxcaml instead of ocaml-flambda/flambda-backend in oxcaml/merlin#191, reflecting project evolution
  • Upstream synchronization with Merlin tracking OxCaml revision 05b98d54a75966bf39540157c8bd1f7281a39e57 from oxcaml/oxcaml in oxcaml/merlin#191
  • Metaprogramming maturity progressing across repositories with quotation APIs in oxcaml/oxcaml#4896 supporting the 2,805-line CamlinternalQuote module now available in oxcaml/merlin#191

    • Emerging Trends

  • Metaprogramming as core feature with investment in quotation infrastructure across oxcaml/oxcaml#4896, oxcaml/oxcaml#4895, oxcaml/oxcaml#4899, oxcaml/oxcaml#4900, and integration into Merlin via oxcaml/merlin#191
  • Mode-aware type system evolution with multiple PRs refining uniqueness, locality, and sharing constraints in oxcaml/oxcaml#4889, oxcaml/oxcaml#4792, oxcaml/oxcaml#4891, and global/aliased relationship work
  • Backend optimization caution demonstrated by reverts in oxcaml/oxcaml#4893 and oxcaml/oxcaml#4885 when optimizations cause backtrace or loop analysis issues, prioritizing correctness
  • Effects system maturation with continuation handling in oxcaml/oxcaml#4901, preemption support in oxcaml/oxcaml#4881, and domain lock unification in oxcaml/oxcaml#4769
  • Language extensibility through maturity-tracked extensions (alpha/beta/stable levels) enabling gradual rollout of experimental features like layout polymorphism in oxcaml/merlin#191
  • Upstream compatibility focus with work allowing erasable features like bits8/bits16 kinds without extensions in oxcaml/oxcaml#4898 and toplevel fixes in oxcaml/oxcaml#4877
  • Patch stability challenges in jsofocaml integration with recurring issues where resolved patches reappear in oxcaml/opam-repository#20 and oxcaml/opam-repository#19
  • AI-assisted development workflow with explicit acknowledgment of Claude for automated conflict resolution and compilation fixes in oxcaml/merlin#191
entry.summary: Metaprogramming advances, Merlin integration of quotation infrastructure, and js_of_ocaml patch maintenance

entry.title: Week 41, 2025: Runtime metaprogramming and JavaScript backend integration merged, plus comprehensive package ecosystem expansion with Jane Street v0.18 preview.
entry.content:
New Features

  • Runtime quotations and metaprogramming system with new <[ ]> quotation syntax and $ splicing operator for runtime code generation and evaluation, including stage tracking in the type system and AST representation in CamlInternalQuote module by Andrej Ivakovi, Jack Rickard, and Mark Shinwell (oxcaml/oxcaml#4395, oxcaml/oxcaml#4852, oxcaml/oxcaml#4864, oxcaml/oxcaml#4874, oxcaml/oxcaml#4855, oxcaml/oxcaml#4856)
  • Full jsofocaml compiler integration imported into oxcaml with JSIR mode for JavaScript compilation and complete backend support by Jacob Van Buren and Leo Lee (oxcaml/oxcaml#4730, oxcaml/oxcaml#4737, oxcaml/oxcaml#4739, oxcaml/oxcaml#4743)
  • Block indices moved to stable production-ready status with new %unsafe_get_ptr and %unsafe_set_ptr primitives, improved flattened float field handling with unboxed types, and safety constraint disallowing block indices to [@atomic] fields by Ryan Tjoa and Chris Casinghino (oxcaml/oxcaml#4827, oxcaml/oxcaml#4824, oxcaml/oxcaml#4826, oxcaml/oxcaml#4828)
  • jsofocaml 6.0.1+ox patches updated with atomic operations support, comprehensive unboxed indexing implementation (1531 lines), local bytes support, and fixes for global deadcode analysis and GitHub issue ocsigen/jsofocaml#2034 by Anil Madhavapeddy (oxcaml/opam-repository@eeedfd91)
  • ctypes 0.23.0+ox and ctypes-foreign 0.23.0+ox added with bigarray compatibility patches for the oxcaml variant by Anil Madhavapeddy (oxcaml/opam-repository@5384cd12)
  • dune 3.20.2+ox, dune-rpc 3.20.2+ox, dyn 3.20.2+ox, ocamlc-loc 3.20.2+ox, and ordering 3.20.2+ox packages introduced with oxcaml-specific patches by Anil Madhavapeddy (oxcaml/opam-repository@26cb9899)
  • lwt 5.9.2+ox library added with oxcaml compatibility patches by Anil Madhavapeddy (oxcaml/opam-repository@26cb9899)
  • re 1.14.0+ox regular expression library added with extensive portability patches (825 lines), iarray support, and fixes for PCRE split functionality by Anil Madhavapeddy (oxcaml/opam-repository@26cb9899)
  • zarith 1.14+ox merged enabling installation of latest TLS libraries by Anil Madhavapeddy (oxcaml/opam-repository#14)
  • CFG terminator simplification improves compilation of for loops by eliminating redundant jumps through rewriting unconditional jumps to conditional jumps, saving one comparison in simple loops by Xavier Clerc (oxcaml/oxcaml#4772)
  • Lambda layout specialization enhancement uses externality information to avoid unnecessary caml_modify calls in specialized code through more precise GC-ignorability analysis by Jakub Bachurski and Ryan Tjoa (oxcaml/oxcaml#4853)
  • Polymorphic variants with-bounds restored with performance fixes addressing pathological fuel algorithm cases and early termination optimization for mode-crossing by Liam Stevenson and Richard Eisenberg (oxcaml/oxcaml#4847)
  • New -gdwarf-may-alter-codegen-experimental flag enables experimental DWARF debugging features by Mark Shinwell (oxcaml/oxcaml#4871)
  • Fixed allocation site information for inlined closures to correct debuginfo showing in OCaml backtraces and Memtrace by Vincent Laviron (oxcaml/oxcaml#4842, fixes oxcaml/oxcaml#4831)
  • Fixed Multicore.spawn soundness issue by requiring resource argument to be contended and annotating as once for flexibility by Vesa Karvonen (oxcaml/oxcaml#4875)
  • Fixed jkind normalization soundness bug with modalities by tracking modalities when skipping previously seen types by Liam Stevenson (oxcaml/oxcaml#4777)
  • Fixed over-expunged toplevel by removing Floatu, Iarray, IarrayLabels, Int32u, Int64u, Nativeintu from toplevel as these aren't in compatible Stdlib, spotted during ICFP tutorial by David Allsopp (oxcaml/oxcaml#4877)
  • Fixed zero_alloc warning scope so top-level [@@@warning "-199"] works correctly by saving scope where attribute is encountered by Greta Yorsh (oxcaml/oxcaml#4819)
  • Fixed atomic fields in mixed blocks miscompilation by rejecting unsupported cases where atomic fields get wrong field index by Aspen Smith (oxcaml/oxcaml#4868)
  • Fixed bytecode differentiation between Bytes.get and String.get needed by jsofocaml for different representations by Jrme Vouillon (oxcaml/oxcaml#4782)
  • Fixed jsofocaml-compiler 6.0.1+ox patch application errors by updating iarray primitives and floatarray patches by Anil Madhavapeddy (oxcaml/opam-repository#12)

    • Group Overview

  • oxcaml/oxcaml: Merged 40+ PRs including foundational runtime quotations system with 9,312 additions (oxcaml/oxcaml#4395), full jsofocaml integration with 303,437 additions (oxcaml/oxcaml#4730), and moved block indices to stable production status (oxcaml/oxcaml#4827), with 23 new PRs opened representing future work
  • oxcaml/opam-repository: Released minus-19 with 558 changed files updating Jane Street packages to v0.18~preview.130.55+197 (oxcaml/opam-repository#18), plus added foundational library support including dune 3.20.2, ctypes, lwt, re, and zarith with oxcaml-specific patches
  • oxcaml/merlin: Opened upstream merge PR incorporating OCaml 5.2.0minus-22 changes with AI-assisted conflict resolution (oxcaml/merlin#191), currently under extensive code review by Jack Rickard addressing antiquotation handling and error message concerns
  • oxcaml/jsofocaml: No activity recorded this week
  • janestreet/opam-repository: Resolved cyclic dependency issue between ppxlib and ppxlib_jane caused by multiple opam repository configuration (janestreet/opam-repository#74)

    • Cross-Repository Work

  • JavaScript compilation pipeline coordinated across oxcaml/oxcaml and oxcaml/opam-repository with jsofocaml 6.0.1 compiler integration (oxcaml/oxcaml#4730) synchronized with opam package patches for atomic operations, unboxed indexing, and local bytes support (oxcaml/opam-repository@eeedfd91)
  • Runtime metaprogramming infrastructure landed in oxcaml/oxcaml with quotation system (oxcaml/oxcaml#4395), requiring corresponding CamlinternalQuote module import in oxcaml/merlin for IDE support (oxcaml/merlin#191)
  • Jane Street ecosystem coordination between oxcaml/opam-repository release minus-19 with v0.18~preview.130.55+197 packages (oxcaml/opam-repository#18) and janestreet/opam-repository dependency resolution (janestreet/opam-repository#74), highlighting need to avoid mixing bleeding-edge and ox repositories
  • Build tooling alignment with dune 3.20.2+ox packages added to oxcaml/opam-repository (oxcaml/opam-repository@26cb9899) coordinating with oxcaml compiler build system improvements including Dune max version check removal in oxcaml/oxcaml (oxcaml/oxcaml#4866)
  • Bytecode compatibility work across repositories with Bytes.get/String.get differentiation in oxcaml/oxcaml (oxcaml/oxcaml#4782) supporting jsofocaml JSIR mode requirements (oxcaml/oxcaml#4739)

    • Notable Discussions

  • Runtime quotations extensive review of oxcaml/oxcaml#4395 with 65+ comments from Zesen Qian and Mark Shinwell discussing stage tracking, type system integration, GADT support, and uniqueness analysis across 9,312 additions in 72 files
  • Wrong allocation site information for inlined closures reported by Stephen Dolan in oxcaml/oxcaml#4831 about missing inlined frames affecting OCaml backtraces and Memtrace accuracy, fixed by Vincent Laviron (oxcaml/oxcaml#4842)
  • Register availability analysis detailed technical review of oxcaml/oxcaml#4835 with 25+ comments from Greta Yorsh addressing Unreachable handling, register comparisons, machtype comparisons, and debug info concerns
  • Backend parameterization design discussions in oxcaml/oxcaml#4825 about interface design for modular backends enabling jsofocaml integration by Jacob Van Buren
  • Polymorphic variants performance concerns in oxcaml/oxcaml#4847 about fuel algorithm with Richard Eisenberg approval requesting monitoring to avoid repeating June performance issues
  • Merlin merge complexity in oxcaml/merlin#191 with Jack Rickard providing 10 review comments identifying potential issues including odd removals, incorrect descriptions, missing text from oxcaml, and concerns about tailcall handling in antiquotations
  • For loop optimization approaches debated in oxcaml/oxcaml#4752 with Akshat proposing lambda simplification approach while Guillaume Bury noted simplif happens before inlining, related to implementation PRs by Xavier Clerc (oxcaml/oxcaml#4772, oxcaml/oxcaml#4807)

    • Emerging Trends

  • Metaprogramming infrastructure build-out with runtime quotations introducing <[ ]> syntax and $ splicing in oxcaml/oxcaml, ocaml-jit integration for JIT compilation, stage tracking in type system, and foundation for staged computation (oxcaml/oxcaml#4395, oxcaml/oxcaml#4852, oxcaml/oxcaml#4864, oxcaml/oxcaml#4874, oxcaml/oxcaml#4855, oxcaml/oxcaml#4856)
  • JavaScript backend maturation with full jsofocaml integration importing 300K+ lines of code in oxcaml/oxcaml, JSIR mode development, making ocamlj a fully-featured compiler, and coordinated opam package updates in oxcaml/opam-repository (oxcaml/oxcaml#4730, oxcaml/oxcaml#4737, oxcaml/oxcaml#4739, oxcaml/oxcaml#4743, oxcaml/oxcaml#4791, oxcaml/oxcaml#4753)
  • DWARF debugging improvements across oxcaml/oxcaml through continuous refinement including register availability analysis, better debuginfo for inlined code, experimental flags for testing new features, with consistent collaboration between Mark Shinwell and Greta Yorsh (oxcaml/oxcaml#4835, oxcaml/oxcaml#4870, oxcaml/oxcaml#4871, oxcaml/oxcaml#4872, oxcaml/oxcaml#4837, oxcaml/oxcaml#4863, oxcaml/oxcaml#4842, oxcaml/oxcaml#4834, oxcaml/oxcaml#4829)
  • Type system evolution in oxcaml/oxcaml with unboxed types moving to production through block indices stabilization, mode system refactoring for extensibility, jkind normalization fixes, and modality tracking improvements (oxcaml/oxcaml#4827, oxcaml/oxcaml#4824, oxcaml/oxcaml#4826, oxcaml/oxcaml#4828, oxcaml/oxcaml#4790, oxcaml/oxcaml#4777)
  • Package ecosystem expansion in oxcaml/opam-repository with Jane Street v0.18~preview.130.55+197 bringing latest experimental features, addition of widely-used OCaml libraries (ctypes, lwt, re, dune 3.20.2) ensuring broader compatibility with existing OCaml codebases (oxcaml/opam-repository#18, oxcaml/opam-repository@26cb9899)
  • CI and build infrastructure modernization across oxcaml/oxcaml through setup-ocaml adoption, speed optimizations saving 15+ seconds per job, Nix flake integration, and automated diff promotion workflows (oxcaml/oxcaml#4857, oxcaml/oxcaml#4858, oxcaml/oxcaml#4859, oxcaml/oxcaml#4711, oxcaml/oxcaml#4810)
  • Backend modularity refactoring in oxcaml/oxcaml for parameterized backends, splitting monolithic files like asmlink into three files, and preparing for multiple target architectures (oxcaml/oxcaml#4825, oxcaml/oxcaml#4838)
  • IDE tooling synchronization with oxcaml/merlin upstream merge incorporating compiler changes including runtime quotations support, demonstrating commitment to keeping editor integration current with language developments (oxcaml/merlin#191)
entry.summary: Runtime metaprogramming and JavaScript backend integration merged, plus comprehensive package ecosystem expansion with Jane Street v0.18 preview.

entry.title: Week 40, 2025: Main oxcaml repository advances js_of_ocaml integration, mode system, and Flambda2 optimizations with tooling improvements
entry.content:
New Features

  • oxcaml/oxcaml#4787: New -reaper-preserve-direct-calls flag with options never, always, zero-alloc, and auto to control direct call preservation strategy in the reaper pass for Flambda2
  • oxcaml/oxcaml#4804: Debugging support now enabled by default with -g added to default compilation flags by Jack Rickard
  • oxcaml/oxcaml#4788: New jkind immediate64_or_null for 64-bit immediate values that can be null by @dkalinichenko-js
  • oxcaml/oxcaml#4818: Datalog debugging infrastructure added with provenance information for easier troubleshooting by Basile Clment
  • oxcaml/oxcaml#4719: Mode error messages improved by printing both sides separately for easier integration by Zesen Qian
  • oxcaml/oxcaml#4634: Mode hints now displayed in inclusion errors for better diagnostics by Zesen Qian
  • oxcaml/oxcaml#4806: Block indices now cross all modal axes, expanding their applicability by Ryan Tjoa
  • oxcaml/merlin#190: Added merlin.ppx_template_generated attribute support for marking identifiers generated by ppx_template in completion results by Liam Stevenson
  • oxcaml/merlin#190: Completion results now include ppx_template_generated boolean field in JSON responses when identifiers are marked with the attribute
  • oxcaml/opam-repository#16: Fixed uutf.1.0.3+ox package conflict declaration to mark Cmdliner 2.0 as incompatible by Marek Kubica

    • Group Overview

  • Main development concentrated in oxcaml/oxcaml repository with 26 active contributors and approximately 40 merged PRs across Flambda2 optimizations, mode system evolution, datalog infrastructure, and jsofocaml integration
  • Basile Clment delivered five datalog infrastructure PRs (oxcaml/oxcaml#4814, oxcaml/oxcaml#4815, oxcaml/oxcaml#4816, oxcaml/oxcaml#4817, oxcaml/oxcaml#4818) improving debugging and query representation
  • Zesen Qian advanced mode system extensibility with six PRs including new staticity axis (oxcaml/oxcaml#4799) and improved error reporting (oxcaml/oxcaml#4719, oxcaml/oxcaml#4634)
  • Jacob Van Buren led jsofocaml integration with compiler changes (oxcaml/oxcaml#4791), sourcemap fixes (oxcaml/oxcaml#4792), and linking optimizations (oxcaml/oxcaml#4793)
  • Ryan Tjoa pushed block indices toward stable status with five PRs including modal axis expansion (oxcaml/oxcaml#4806), stabilization (oxcaml/oxcaml#4827), and new primitives (oxcaml/oxcaml#4828)
  • Minimal activity in supporting repositories: oxcaml/opam-repository merged two PRs for package compatibility, oxcaml/merlin merged one PR for ppxtemplate support, and no activity in oxcaml/jsof_ocaml or janestreet/opam-repository

    • Cross-Repository Work

  • Cmdliner compatibility work coordinated between oxcaml/opam-repository#16 and upstream ocaml/opam-repository, with Marek Kubica porting conflict declaration fixes for Cmdliner 2.0 to the oxcaml fork
  • jsofocaml integration in oxcaml/oxcaml#4791, oxcaml/oxcaml#4792, oxcaml/oxcaml#4793 laying groundwork for future work in oxcaml/jsofocaml repository
  • ppxtemplate attribute added to oxcaml/merlin#190 supporting tooling integration for code generated by ppxtemplate in oxcaml/oxcaml

    • Notable Discussions

  • Jsofocaml integration architecture generated 46 comments on oxcaml/oxcaml#4791 discussing compiler and driver changes, integration approach, and compatibility considerations
  • Reaper direct call preservation sparked 33-comment discussion on oxcaml/oxcaml#4787 debating zero-alloc function handling strategy and trade-offs between optimization levels
  • Mode hints in errors had 10 comments on oxcaml/oxcaml#4634 debating presentation and integration approaches for better error diagnostics
  • Staticity mode axis generated 8 comments on oxcaml/oxcaml#4799 exploring design decisions and implications for the mode system
  • Metrics CSV tracking discussed through 7 comments on oxcaml/oxcaml#4822 improving CI infrastructure and data collection

    • Emerging Trends

  • Flambda2 maturity progressing through systematic datalog infrastructure improvements (oxcaml/oxcaml#4814, oxcaml/oxcaml#4815, oxcaml/oxcaml#4816, oxcaml/oxcaml#4817, oxcaml/oxcaml#4818), match-in-match bug fixes (oxcaml/oxcaml#4751), reaper refinements (oxcaml/oxcaml#4787), and zero-allocation optimization work (oxcaml/oxcaml#4811)
  • Mode system evolution showing architectural improvements for extensibility with new axis addition support (oxcaml/oxcaml#4789), staticity axis introduction (oxcaml/oxcaml#4799), and better error reporting (oxcaml/oxcaml#4719, oxcaml/oxcaml#4634)
  • Unboxed types stabilization accelerating with block indices moving from experimental to stable (oxcaml/oxcaml#4827), expanded modal coverage (oxcaml/oxcaml#4806), and new primitive operations (oxcaml/oxcaml#4828)
  • Backend flexibility increasing through jsofocaml integration work (oxcaml/oxcaml#4791, oxcaml/oxcaml#4792, oxcaml/oxcaml#4793) and optcomp parameterization (oxcaml/oxcaml#4823)
  • Developer experience improvements through default debug flag enablement (oxcaml/oxcaml#4804), CI workflow automation (oxcaml/oxcaml#4808, oxcaml/oxcaml#4809), metrics tracking (oxcaml/oxcaml#4822), documentation fixes (oxcaml/oxcaml#4774), and improved tooling support (oxcaml/merlin#190)
entry.summary: Main oxcaml repository advances js_of_ocaml integration, mode system, and Flambda2 optimizations with tooling improvements

entry.title: Week 39, 2025: Major TLS implementation and LLVM backend improvements in oxcaml core with package compatibility work across repositories
entry.content:
New Features

  • Thread-local storage (TLS) implementation in oxcaml/oxcaml#4747 with comprehensive API in Domain.TLS and Thread.TLS modules, providing per-thread data storage alongside existing Domain-local storage
  • Forkable mode axis added in oxcaml/oxcaml#4748 to track whether functions can access shared values in parent stack, with documentation and default behaviors based on locality
  • Layout polymorphism extension infrastructure in oxcaml/oxcaml#4756 with layout_poly extension available in alpha/beta/stable maturity levels
  • SIMD constants and casts updated in oxcaml/oxcaml#4778 to use int8#/int16# types with sign-extension, improving type safety for SIMD operations
  • LLVM backend float data emission improvements in oxcaml/oxcaml#4784 now using bitwise representations instead of textual format to avoid NaN issues
  • Oxidized ppx_deriving package version 6.1.1+ox added in oxcaml/opam-repository#13 with compatibility patches for oxcaml parsetree changes
  • Nix flake build fixes in oxcaml/merlin#188 including updated nixpkgs dependencies and build process improvements with disabled check phase for merlin

    • Group Overview

  • Core compiler development dominated by Jacob Van Buren's massive jsofocaml import in oxcaml/oxcaml#4753 and extensive threading infrastructure with TLS implementation in oxcaml/oxcaml#4747
  • LLVM backend maturation through multiple improvements by Yusuf Onur mez including exception handling fixes in oxcaml/oxcaml#4757 and frametable improvements in oxcaml/oxcaml#4760
  • Package ecosystem stability work with Patrick Ferris delivering oxidized ppx_deriving in oxcaml/opam-repository#13 and ongoing zarith library updates in oxcaml/opam-repository#14
  • Infrastructure maintenance across repositories including George Shammas's Nix improvements in oxcaml/merlin#188 and CI metrics collection in oxcaml/oxcaml#4762
  • Type system evolution with layout polymorphism groundwork in oxcaml/oxcaml#4756 and mode system refinements in oxcaml/oxcaml#4766

    • Cross-Repository Work

  • jsofocaml integration spanning multiple repositories with the large import in oxcaml/oxcaml#4753 requiring bytecode compilation improvements in oxcaml/oxcaml#4782 and future coordination with the separate oxcaml/jsofocaml repository
  • Package compatibility efforts between oxcaml/opam-repository and janestreet/opam-repository highlighted by cyclic dependency analysis in janestreet/opam-repository#74
  • Oxidized library ecosystem development with ppx_deriving success in oxcaml/opam-repository#13 and ongoing zarith work in oxcaml/opam-repository#14 supporting oxcaml parsetree changes
  • Development tooling alignment with Nix infrastructure improvements in oxcaml/merlin#188 supporting the broader oxcaml development environment

    • Notable Discussions

  • Package dependency analysis by Gopher in janestreet/opam-repository#74 comparing ppxlib_jane dependencies between janestreet/opam-repository and oxcaml/opam-repository, highlighting version constraint differences causing cyclic dependency conflicts
  • For loop optimization discussion initiated by Xavier Clerc in oxcaml/oxcaml#4752 requesting optimization of for loops with () body after inlining or functor application
  • Repository update issues reported by Henry Till in oxcaml/opam-repository#15 affecting opam 2.3.0 users on Debian with detailed troubleshooting context

    • Emerging Trends

  • Threading infrastructure expansion with TLS implementation in oxcaml/oxcaml#4747 and domain improvements in oxcaml/oxcaml#4764, building foundation for enhanced multi-threaded programming support
  • LLVM backend maturation through systematic improvements including exception handling in oxcaml/oxcaml#4757, frametables in oxcaml/oxcaml#4760, and float data emission in oxcaml/oxcaml#4784
  • Type system evolution with layout polymorphism infrastructure in oxcaml/oxcaml#4756, mode system refinements in oxcaml/oxcaml#4766, and jkind improvements in oxcaml/oxcaml#4777
  • Package ecosystem integration with oxidized library adaptations like ppx_deriving in oxcaml/opam-repository#13 and dependency coordination between repositories in janestreet/opam-repository#74
  • Development automation focus with comprehensive CI metrics collection across oxcaml/oxcaml#4762-oxcaml/oxcaml#4771 and build infrastructure improvements in oxcaml/merlin#188
entry.summary: Major TLS implementation and LLVM backend improvements in oxcaml core with package compatibility work across repositories

entry.title: Week 38, 2025: Major LLVM backend refactor and JavaScript integration progress with Merlin tooling improvements and build issues in packaging
entry.content:
New Features

  • LLVM backend refactor by Yusuf Onur mez brings architectural improvements to the oxcaml compilation pipeline (oxcaml/oxcaml#4722)
  • Syntax hovers for oxcaml language constructs with detailed English descriptions for IDE support by Liam Stevenson (oxcaml/merlin#168)
  • Performance fix for exponential short-paths algorithm that was causing 40+ minute delays in large codebases by Liam Stevenson (oxcaml/merlin#182)
  • Register allocation attributes [@regalloc], [@regalloc_param] and [@cold] added by Xavier Clerc for fine-grained optimization control (oxcaml/oxcaml#4633)

  • JSIR backend improvements including unbound variable bug fix (oxcaml/oxcaml#4727) and machine width value corrections (oxcaml/oxcaml#4726) by Mark Shinwell and Leo Lee
  • External function support for unboxed product returns of value kind by Mark Shinwell (oxcaml/oxcaml#4728)

    • Group Overview

  • Active development week with 24 merged PRs across oxcaml core and Merlin, plus ongoing JavaScript backend integration efforts
  • Major architectural changes including LLVM backend refactor (oxcaml/oxcaml#4722) and compiler synchronization (oxcaml/merlin#185)

  • Compiler synchronization between oxcaml core and Merlin tooling with major merge from 5.2.0minus-19 (oxcaml/merlin#185) including cross-references to oxcaml core issues (oxcaml/oxcaml#4658)
